com.orchestranetworks.service.extensions
Class LockSpec

java.lang.Object
  com.orchestranetworks.service.extensions.LockSpec
public class LockSpec
extends Object

Handles a lock over a data space. When locked, a data space can only be modified by the owner of the lock.

The methods to call for locking and unlocking a data space are lock(AdaptationHome, Session) and unlock(AdaptationHome, Session).

Constructor Detail

LockSpec

public LockSpec()
Method Detail

lock

public void lock(AdaptationHome aDataSpace,
                 Session aSession)
          throws OperationException
Locks the specified data space.

If the data space is already locked, this method throws an exception.

Note: this method cannot be called inside a procedure execution (because of transaction management restrictions).

A user can lock a data space if:

  • he is its "super owner" (see Permissions reference page);
  • or he is administrator;
  • or the LockSpec instance is in a setOwnerPrivileges(boolean) mode.

Throws:
OperationException
See Also:
SessionPermissions.getHomeActionPermissionToLockHome(LockSpec, AdaptationHome)

unlock

public void unlock(AdaptationHome aDataSpace,
                   Session aSession)
            throws OperationException
Unlocks the data space specified.

If the data space is already unlocked, this method throws an exception.

When data space is locked, a user can unlock it if:

  • he is the owner of the lock;
  • or he is branch's "super owner" (see permissions);
  • or he is administrator;
  • or the LockSpec instance is in a setOwnerPrivileges(boolean) mode.

And if:

  • The reason for unlocking is the same that locked (i.e. if locked from the user interface, the user interface must be used to unlock.);
  • or the LockSpec instance is in a setIgnoreLockReason(boolean) mode.

Note:

  • this method cannot be called inside a procedure execution (because of transaction management restrictions).
  • if the parent or child data space has also been locked (for instance during a merge procedure), only current data space will be unlocked. Another LockSpec will have to be created to unlock it.

    • Throws:
    OperationException
    See Also:
    SessionPermissions.getHomeActionPermissionToUnlockHome(LockSpec, AdaptationHome)

setDescription(UserMessage)

setDescription

public void setDescription(UserMessage description)
Specifies a message describing the purpose or the context of the lock.

This possibly internationalized message is displayed in EBX5 when the user accesses a data space that is locked.

If true it will be possible to create a child data space.
